title: Japan: SMBC Group and Citi to Start a New Global Support Program for Retail Customers
summary: Tokyo – Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group, Inc. (President and CEO: Jun Ota, hereinafter referred to as "SMBC Group"), SMBC Trust Bank, Ltd. (President: Kozo Ogino, hereinafter referred to as "SMBC Trust Bank") and Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation (CEO, Makoto Takashima, "SMBC") have entered into an agreement with Citibank, N.A. (CEO Mary McNiff, "Citibank"), a wholly owned subsidiary of Citigroup Inc. (CEO, Michael Corbat, "Citi"). This agreement expands services to SMBC Trust Bank customers with a Global Support program for customers relocating and travelling overseas in markets where Citi has a retail banking presence.
tag-1: Japan: SMBC Group and Citi to Start a New Global Support Program for Retail Customers
tag-2: Tokyo – Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group, Inc. (President and CEO: Jun Ota, hereinafter referred to as "SMBC Group"), SMBC Trust Bank, Ltd. (President: Kozo Ogino, hereinafter referred to as "SMBC Trust Bank") and Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation (CEO, Makoto Takashima, "SMBC") have entered into an agreement with Citibank, N.A. (CEO Mary McNiff, "Citibank"), a wholly owned subsidiary of Citigroup Inc. (CEO, Michael Corbat, "Citi"). This agreement expands services to SMBC Trust Bank customers with a Global Support program for customers relocating and travelling overseas in markets where Citi has a retail banking presence.
tag-3: 1. The services made available through Global Support program
tag-5: For customers relocating from Japan to the United States, the banks have agreed to help customers find U.S. Citibank® branch locations for service in Japanese. For relocating PRESTIA Gold customers, SMBC Trust Bank can help arrange an appointment with a Citigold® Relationship Manager in the U.S. Citibank can help its U.S. Citigold customers moving to Japan with similar assistance. Citigold is a comprehensive wealth management, banking and investments offering of Citi for qualifying clients.
tag-7: When SMBC Trust Bank customers withdraw cash with "GLOBAL PASS® (a multi-currency Visa debit-combined cash card)" they can use participating Citi ATMs in 17 countries and jurisdictions (*) without a surcharge fee.
tag-8: * United States, Mexico, United Kingdom, Russia, Poland, South Korea, Taiwan, Hong Kong SAR, Indonesia, Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, Vietnam, Malaysia, India, UAE, Bahrain
tag-10: PRESTIA Gold customers have access to Citigold lounges in seven cities (New York, Miami, San Francisco, London, Singapore, Hong Kong and Shanghai).
tag-12: Launch of services will be Monday, December 2, 2019.
tag-13: In addition to the launch of the Global Support program, Citi, SMBC and SMBC Trust Bank are exploring ways to work together to benefit global retail wealth management customers.
tag-14: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
